intro: Erucastrum obtusangulum, commonly known as the broad-leafed erucaceous, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many species with characteristic cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and has lance-shaped, hairy leaves. Its flowers are small and yellow, often clustered in racemes, and it produces elongated pods containing seeds. It is often found in dry, sunny habitats and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
